intro: Silene congesta, commonly known as the clustered catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are opposite and covered in fine hairs, and it has a short, branching stem. Silene congesta is often found in open areas such as sagebrush steppe and desert scrub.
